es.title: La Guia Definitiva: Del Marketing 1.0 al 4.0
es.excerpt: El marketing ha tenido diferentes enfoques a lo largo de la historia. Descubre en esta publicacion su evolucion, la perspectiva del experto Philip Kotler y lo que depara la version 4.0.
es.metaDescription: Descubre la evolucion del Marketing desde el 1.0 hasta el 4.0 con Philip Kotler. Guia completa con caracteristicas, ejemplos y estrategias probadas. Transforma tu negocio hoy.

sections.content: El marketing ha tenido que ir adaptando sus objetivos a la par de como han ido cambiando las necesidades y las demandas de los clientes. Desde los inicios donde el producto era el rey absoluto, hasta la era actual donde el proposito social marca la diferencia entre las marcas que triunfan y las que desaparecen.
Conocer la evolucion del marketing te permite entender por que las estrategias del pasado ya no funcionan y como adaptarte al consumidor moderno.
Los Inicios del Marketing 1.0: La Era del Producto

Originalmente las personas se conformaban con el primer producto que se les ofrecia y llegasen a necesitar en ese instante. Imaginemos que vivimos en una era antigua, en un pequeno pueblo donde hay un solo panadero. Hoy necesitas un pan, vas a la tienda y te ofrecen uno que esta duro (posiblemente viejo). No lo quieres? Recuerda que tienes que ir a buscar la siguiente panaderia mas cercana de tu pueblo, se encuentra a un dia cabalgando en un camino lleno de posibles amenazas y peligros... Seguro que no quieres el pan duro?

Ahora han pasado varios anos, ya no solo existe una panaderia en tu pueblo, puedes escoger entre diferentes tiendas y variedades de productos. Y no solo eso! Ahora descubres estos productos en unas cosas llamadas el periodico, la radio y la television.

Desde finales del siglo XIX hasta mediados del siglo XX, el marketing se conoce como la version del marketing 1.0, su enfoque es en base exclusivamente al producto, debido a la poca oferta que existia en el mercado y una alta demanda.
Caracteristicas Esenciales del Marketing 1.0

items: Ser un marketing centrado en vender productos
Tener clientes que solo buscaban cubrir sus necesidades basicas
Pensar que el valor mas importante era el precio
Usar medios de promocion tradicionales con una comunicacion unilateral

sections.content: Origen del Marketing 2.0: La Experiencia del Cliente

Con el pasar del tiempo algo ha cambiado en tu mentalidad, ya no eres un cliente que compra un producto tan solo por su valor economico, ahora te importa mas la experiencia y las emociones que te hacen sentir.

Tu hijo pequeno esta cumpliendo anos y quieres hacerle feliz. A donde lo llevarias? Te dice que le encantan las hamburguesas y los parques infantiles... Que opinas de un lugar llamado McDonalds? Seguro que te suena genial.

Ahora hay muchas marcas que se dieron cuenta de tu nueva necesidad llamada experiencia, piensan en ti mas alla de tan solo el producto y por eso quieren conocer tu opinion para saber lo que realmente es importante para ti.

Con el pasar de los anos la tecnologia ha evolucionado muchisimo. Puedes creer que ahora tienes un telefono movil con internet? A las empresas les encantaria interactuar contigo para saber tu experiencia con ellos.

A mediados y hasta finales del siglo XX surgio el marketing 2.0. Se enfoca en el cliente y sus emociones, debido a que existia una mayor oferta en el mercado lo que genero mas criterios para la eleccion de los productos de los consumidores.
Caracteristicas Clave del Marketing 2.0

items: Ser un marketing centrado en satisfacer y retener a los consumidores
Tener clientes con emociones y con mas criterios de eleccion para comprar
Pensar que el valor mas importante era la persona
Usar medios de promocion tradicionales con comunicacion unilateral y posteriormente medios interactivos con comunicacion bilateral

sections.content: El Nacimiento del Marketing 3.0: Los Valores Humanos

Si entendemos que el nucleo del marketing 1.0 es el producto y del marketing 2.0 es el cliente y su experiencia, el marketing 3.0 tenia que ir mas alla de esos factores. Los marketeros volvieron a preguntarse: Que otra cosa es importante para los clientes? y Que necesidades tienen?

Con el pasar de unos pocos anos gracias a los avances tecnologicos y al surgimiento de nuevas herramientas (como las redes sociales), los marketeros pudieron conocer cada vez mas a sus clientes. De esa forma se adentraron en su psicologia y descubrieron la respuesta:
Somos todos personas. Tenemos diferentes valores y principios, somos humanos, tenemos sentimientos y prioridades como lo pueden ser la familia, la amistad, el amor, la justicia y mas.

Si ves las redes sociales podras ver personas totalmente diferentes bailando, riendo, compartiendo y mucho mas. A inicios del siglo XXI y durante una decada y media surgio el marketing 3.0. Su enfoque principal es dejar de ver al cliente como tan solo un consumidor, comenzaron a verlo como una persona y que tanto ella como la empresa eran parte de una sociedad.
Caracteristicas del Marketing 3.0

items: Ser un marketing centrado en los valores de las personas y en querer hacer un mundo mejor
Tener seres humanos (no solo clientes) con mente, corazon y espiritu
Pensar que el valor mas importante era el ambiente y la comunidad
Usar medios de promocion interactivos con comunicacion multidireccional

sections.content: La Nueva Era: El Marketing 4.0 y el Proposito Social

Bienvenido a la actualidad! Gracias a la globalizacion y a la gran cantidad de informacion que hay en internet, sabes que no muchos han tenido la misma suerte que tu, algunos ninos no tienen calzados para caminar y mucha gente no tiene trabajo ni comida esta noche.

Que opinarias si te digo que por cada 3 euros que gastes en TOMS se donara 1 euro para la elaboracion de zapatillas para estos ninos, o que si comes en Social Bites estas ayudando a muchas personas que vivian en la calle dandoles comida y trabajo? Sentirias que al comprarles un producto a estas empresas haces el mundo un poco mejor?
Ahora las marcas se dieron cuenta que nosotros y ellas somos parte de una comunidad, que coexistimos y que lo mas importante es trabajar juntos para hacer el mundo un mejor lugar para vivir.
A mediados de la segunda decada del siglo XXI surgio el marketing 4.0. Su principal enfoque es el proposito social.
El Origen Segun Philip Kotler

Segun el experto en marketing Philip Kotler: El Marketing 4.0 surge cuando lo offline conoce lo online, el estilo conoce la sustancia y la maquina conoce al humano. Se puede decir que esto se adapta perfectamente a la realidad actual:

items: El mundo esta conectado de miles de formas diferentes con las redes sociales, foros en internet, WhatsApp... Solo observa como se pudieron realizar los teletrabajos en consecuencia del COVID-19.

Cuando realizamos una compra evaluamos muchos factores antes. Quizas no compras un chocolate hecho con aceite de palma o no le compras a empresas de productos cosmeticos que hacen pruebas en animales. Es mas importante para ti tus principios que comprar algo en contra de ellos que sea bueno, bonito, barato o popular.

Seguramente has sentido alguna vez que la publicidad en internet pareciera que te escuchara, te muestra productos y ofertas en el momento que mas lo necesitabas. Google y las redes sociales tienen algoritmos de aprendizajes tan buenos que se puede creer que en algun momento conoceran mas de ti que tu mismo. Esta informacion se conoce como Big Data.

sections.content: Los Clientes del Marketing 4.0: Expertos en Compras
Hay una caracteristica nueva de los clientes que ha dado un giro al mercado. Te has fijado de todo lo que haces antes de realizar una compra importante?

items: 1. Buscar el producto y estudiar todas sus cualidades
2. Ver opiniones online del producto
3. Comparar con otros productos similares
4. Ver opiniones online de esos productos
5. Preguntar a amigos, familiares o conocidos que puedan conocer de los productos que mas te convencen
6. Compras el producto y lo pruebas
7. Compartes tu opinion y puedes llegar a recomendarlo si te gusto

sections.content: Las personas hemos pasado a ser expertos en compras y nos ayudamos entre todos para obtener mejores resultados. Existe una gran cantidad de informacion en internet que ayuda a los compradores y a los vendedores. Despues de todo, si eres una empresa que obtiene malas criticas de un producto sabras exactamente que hacer para mejorarlo y hacer que guste a tus clientes.
Caracteristicas Fundamentales del Marketing 4.0

items: Ser un marketing centrado en el proposito social y con marcas que colaboran con la sociedad para un mundo mejor
Tener marcas y empresas humanas que conectan a nivel emocional
Pensar que satisfacer las necesidades emocionales del cliente era primordial, aprendiendo por medio de la Big Data para dar mejores resultados personalizados
Usar medios de promocion omnicanales con comunicacion omnidireccional, implementando estrategias 360 grados

sections.content: Conclusion: Transforma Tu Estrategia de Marketing

La evolucion del marketing desde el 1.0 hasta el 4.0 nos muestra una leccion fundamental: las marcas que triunfan son las que saben adaptarse a las necesidades cambiantes de las personas. Hoy, eso significa tener un proposito que va mas alla de solo vender productos.
Tu proximo paso: Evalua como tu marca puede contribuir a hacer el mundo un lugar mejor mientras ofreces valor real a tus clientes. Esa es la esencia del Marketing 4.0.

De parte del equipo de Alkitu esperamos que hayas disfrutado de esta cronologia. No olvides de compartir esta publicacion si fue de tu agrado para ayudar a nuestra comunidad y comentarnos tus dudas y opiniones del post para saber que cosas podemos mejorar.

en.title: The Ultimate Guide: From Marketing 1.0 to 4.0
en.excerpt: Marketing has had different approaches throughout history. Discover in this publication its evolution, expert Philip Kotler's perspective, and what version 4.0 holds in store.
en.metaDescription: Discover the evolution of Marketing from 1.0 to 4.0 with Philip Kotler. Complete guide with characteristics, examples, and proven strategies. Transform your business today.

sections.content: Marketing has had to adapt its objectives alongside the changing needs and demands of customers. From the early days where the product was the absolute king, to the current era where social purpose makes the difference between brands that succeed and those that disappear.
Understanding the evolution of marketing allows you to understand why past strategies no longer work and how to adapt to the modern consumer.
The Beginnings of Marketing 1.0: The Product Era

Originally, people were satisfied with the first product offered to them that they might need at that moment. Imagine we live in an ancient era, in a small village where there is only one baker. Today you need bread, you go to the store and they offer you one that is hard (possibly old). You don't want it? Remember that you have to go to the next nearest bakery in your village, it is a day's ride away on a road full of possible threats and dangers... Are you sure you don't want the stale bread?

Now several years have passed, there is no longer just one bakery in your village, you can choose from different stores and varieties of products. And not only that! Now you discover these products in things called the newspaper, the radio, and the television.

From the late 19th century until the mid-20th century, marketing is known as the version of marketing 1.0, its focus is exclusively on the product, due to the low supply that existed in the market and high demand.
Essential Characteristics of Marketing 1.0

items: Being a marketing focused on selling products
Having customers who only sought to cover their basic needs
Thinking that price was the most important value
Using traditional promotional media with one-way communication

sections.content: Origin of Marketing 2.0: The Customer Experience
Over time something has changed in your mindset, you are no longer a customer who buys a product just for its economic value, now you care more about the experience and emotions they make you feel.

Your little son is having a birthday and you want to make him happy. Where would you take him? He tells you he loves hamburgers and playgrounds... What do you think about a place called McDonald's? It surely sounds great.

Now there are many brands that realized your new need called experience, they think of you beyond just the product and that's why they want to know your opinion to understand what is really important to you.
Over the years technology has evolved tremendously. Can you believe you now have a mobile phone with internet? Companies would love to interact with you to know your experience with them.

In the mid to late 20th century, marketing 2.0 emerged. It focuses on the customer and their emotions, because there was a greater supply in the market which generated more criteria for consumers' product choices.
Key Characteristics of Marketing 2.0

items: Being a marketing focused on satisfying and retaining consumers
Having customers with emotions and more criteria for purchasing choices
Thinking that the most important value was the person
Using traditional promotional media with one-way communication and later interactive media with two-way communication

sections.content: The Birth of Marketing 3.0: Human Values

If we understand that the core of marketing 1.0 is the product and marketing 2.0 is the customer and their experience, marketing 3.0 had to go beyond those factors. Marketers asked themselves again: What else is important to customers? And what needs do they have?

Over the course of a few years, thanks to technological advances and the emergence of new tools (such as social networks), marketers were able to get to know their customers more and more. In this way, they delved into their psychology and discovered the answer:
We are all people. We have different values and principles, we are human, we have feelings and priorities such as family, friendship, love, justice and more.

If you look at social networks you will see completely different people dancing, laughing, sharing and much more. At the beginning of the 21st century and for a decade and a half, marketing 3.0 emerged. Its main focus is to stop seeing the customer as just a consumer, they began to see them as a person and that both they and the company were part of a society.
Characteristics of Marketing 3.0

items: Being a marketing focused on people's values and wanting to make a better world
Having human beings (not just customers) with mind, heart and spirit
Thinking that the most important value was the environment and community
Using interactive promotional media with multidirectional communication

sections.content: The New Era: Marketing 4.0 and Social Purpose

Welcome to the present! Thanks to globalization and the vast amount of information on the internet, you know that not many have been as lucky as you, some children do not have shoes to walk in and many people do not have work or food tonight.

What would you think if I told you that for every 3 euros you spend at TOMS, 1 euro will be donated for the production of sneakers for these children, or that if you eat at Social Bites you are helping many people who lived on the street by giving them food and work? Would you feel that by buying a product from these companies you are making the world a little better?
Now brands have realized that we and they are part of a community, that we coexist and that the most important thing is to work together to make the world a better place to live.
In the middle of the second decade of the 21st century, marketing 4.0 emerged. Its main focus is social purpose.
The Origin According to Philip Kotler
According to marketing expert Philip Kotler: Marketing 4.0 emerges when offline meets online, style meets substance and machine meets human. This can be said to adapt perfectly to current reality:

items: The world is connected in thousands of different ways with social networks, internet forums, WhatsApp... Just observe how teleworking could be carried out as a result of COVID-19.

When we make a purchase we evaluate many factors beforehand. Maybe you don't buy chocolate made with palm oil or you don't buy from cosmetic companies that test on animals. Your principles are more important to you than buying something against them that is good, pretty, cheap or popular.

Surely you have felt at some point that internet advertising seems to listen to you, showing you products and offers at the moment you needed them most. Google and social networks have such good learning algorithms that it can be believed that at some point they will know more about you than yourself. This information is known as Big Data.

sections.content: Marketing 4.0 Customers: Shopping Experts
There is a new characteristic of customers that has turned the market around. Have you noticed everything you do before making an important purchase?

items: 1. Search for the product and study all its qualities
2. See online reviews of the product
3. Compare with other similar products
4. See online reviews of those products
5. Ask friends, family or acquaintances who may know about the products that convince you the most
6. Buy the product and try it
7. Share your opinion and you may recommend it if you liked it

sections.content: People have become shopping experts and we help each other to get better results. There is a great amount of information on the internet that helps buyers and sellers. After all, if you are a company that gets bad reviews for a product you will know exactly what to do to improve it and make your customers like it.
Fundamental Characteristics of Marketing 4.0

items: Being a marketing focused on social purpose and with brands that collaborate with society for a better world
Having human brands and companies that connect on an emotional level
Thinking that satisfying the emotional needs of the customer was essential, learning through Big Data to give better personalized results
Using omnichannel promotional media with omnidirectional communication, implementing 360-degree strategies

sections.content: Conclusion: Transform Your Marketing Strategy

The evolution of marketing from 1.0 to 4.0 teaches us a fundamental lesson: the brands that succeed are those that know how to adapt to the changing needs of people. Today, that means having a purpose that goes beyond just selling products.
Your next step: Evaluate how your brand can contribute to making the world a better place while offering real value to your customers. That is the essence of Marketing 4.0.

From the Alkitu team we hope you enjoyed this timeline. Don't forget to share this post if you liked it to help our community and let us know your questions and opinions about the post so we know what we can improve.
